alert.note: Alert for Bath; Breathitt; Elliott; Estill; Lee; Magoffin; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Owsley; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:52AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, northeastern Owsley, Menifee, Lee, southern Rowan, Wolfe, Powell, Morgan, southeastern Bath, northeastern Estill, Breathitt, Magoffin and southwestern Elliott Counties through 430 AM EDT... At 352 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Freestone to Bangor to Wellington to near Red River Gorge to Cobhill. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wellington, Calaboose, Stoll, Ezel, Valeria, Pomeroyton, Artville, Korea, Dan and Pine Ridge around 355 AM EDT. Campton, Gosneyville, Stillwater, Trent, Murphyfork, Maytown, Toliver, Pekin and Ebon around 400 AM EDT. Beattyville, Rexville, Dehart, Zag, Yocum, Craney, Landsaw, Paragon, Twentysix and Mount Olive around 405 AM EDT. Henry, Fincastle, Sellars, Lexie, Licking River, Blaze, Airedale, Leisure, Pomp and Upper Gilmore around 410 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include West Liberty, Simpson, Lewis, Rosefork, Monica, Shockey, Wrigley, Adele, Primrose, Index, Cottle, Netty, Athol, Epson, Burg, Lick Branch, Florress, Rock Lick, Mountain Valley, Lenox, Matthew, Bays, Copebranch, Elamton, Ova, Seiltz, Guerrant, Puncheon, Oakdale, Stella, Jackson, Salyersville, Mason, Hendricks, Guage, Plutarch, Fritz, Cisco, Tella and Orient. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 18 and 76. Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 129 and 134. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bath; Breathitt; Elliott; Estill; Lee; Magoffin; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Owsley; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe
